Other.description: Other entities not fitting the above categories

Digital Identity.description:
Movement between locations, physical or inferred.

Examples
	•	Same-day Hamburg–Brussels trip
	•	Cross-border travel without clear justification

Typical attributes
	•	Origin and destination
	•	Duration
	•	Purpose (known / unknown)

Why it’s modeled separately
	•	Travel often links persons, locations, and events
	•	Enables detection of coordination or meetings

Travel.description:
Movement between locations, physical or inferred.

Examples
	•	Same-day Hamburg–Brussels trip
	•	Cross-border travel without clear justification

Typical attributes
	•	Origin and destination
	•	Duration
	•	Purpose (known / unknown)

Why it’s modeled separately
	•	Travel often links persons, locations, and events
	•	Enables detection of coordination or meetings

Communication Platform.description:
A medium through which information is exchanged.

Examples
	•	Private discussion forums
	•	Encrypted messaging applications
	•	Social media aliases

Typical attributes
	•	Platform type (forum, messaging app)
	•	Access pattern (spike, baseline, dormant)
	•	Anonymity level

Why investigators model this
	•	Platform choice can indicate intent to conceal
	•	Timing and frequency often correlate with other events
